title: Ed Sheeran’s record label boss steps down over ‘offensive’ Run DMC costume
text:
Ben Cook has stepped down (Picture: Twitter Atlantic Records)

Ed Sheeran’s label boss has stood down as president of Atlantic Records after dressing up as a member of Run DMC at a birthday party.

Ben Cook, who was responsible for giving Sheeran a record deal back in 2011, has shocked the music industry by stepping down from his role after five years.

The label boss had caused offence after it emerged he dressed up as a member of Run DMC at a party seven years ago.

Cook’s statement, released today, read: ‘It is with great sadness that today I announce I am stepping down as President of Atlantic Records, UK.

‘Seven years ago, at a birthday party where guests were asked to come dressed as their favourite musical icon, I came as a member of Run DMC. Late last year rumours began to circulate about my appearance at that event, many of which are simply untrue. While my intention was to honour a musical hero, I recognise my appearance was offensive and I made a terrible mistake.

Ben dressed up as a member of Run DMC (Picture: Michael Ochs Archives/Getty Images)

‘As a consequence of this, I readily agreed to disciplinary actions by my employer last year. Since then however, allegations surrounding the party have continued to be made against me. Moreover, they have been used against a wonderful company and the label I love. I have therefore come to the conclusion that I should make this statement and step down, with immediate effect.’

He continued: ‘I am devastated that this mistake has caused upset and has called into question my commitment to diversity, equality and inclusion, values which I have championed throughout my career. I have learned a great deal from this event and will resolutely continue to champion these values moving forward.

‘It has been an incredible privilege to have worked with the immensely talented artists, managers and team at Atlantic and the wider Warner family.

‘I unreservedly apologise to anyone who has been hurt.’

Ben gave Ed his first record deal (Picture: Luigi Rizzo/Pacific Press/LightRocket via Getty Images)

Warner Music, Atlantic’s parent company, added in their own statement: ‘Ben Cook is leaving Atlantic UK and this will be his last week in the office.’

Cook joined Atlantic Records in 2007 as managing director of the Asylum imprint, after a successful stint at Ministry of Sound.

However, in 2014, he was promoted to President after his huge success with Ed Sheeran.

Cook, along with Ed Howard, offered the songwriter a record deal in 2011 after noticing that his No. 5 Collaborations Project EP had reached number two in the iTunes charts as an independent release.

Ed went on to achieve two of the biggest albums of the decade with 2014’s X and 2017’s Divide, and under Cook’s tenure, Atlantic’s share of the album UK market grew to 7.9%.

Cook was also responsible for signing Stormzy to the label last year in a joint venture agreement with Merky, and worked with Anne-Marie and Rudimental.

The record label also looks after huge stars including Cardi B, Bruno Mars, Clean Bandit, Janelle Monae, Jess Glynne, Rita Ora and Panic! At The Disco.

Parlophone’s co-president Mark Mitchell will act as President on an interim basis.
